results.title: Tomorrow winter comes
results.creator_credit: Therese Dumesnil, Francois Seguillon, Marc Beaudet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: More and more skiers are opting for cross-country skiing rather than schussing down the crowded, and costlier, maintained slopes. This film captures the full pleasure and delight of this more relaxed but equally invigorating winter sport. A small group of skiers is observed on a day’s outing and, as they glide along through quiet Laurentian woodlands, the film notes techniques of movement. Tips are also given on proper clothing and on ski maintenance. In French with English subtitles. (Award: La Baule.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Therese Dumesnil, Francois Seguillon, Marc Beaudet and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Young ones
results.creator_credit: Sidney J. Furie, Kenneth Harper and Associated British Picture Corporation
results.brief_description: The 1960’s saw a proliferation of teenage dance music films from both the United Kingdom and United States when Elvis and Beatlemania were at their height. Cliff Richard’s film “The Young ones” is a prime example of this genre, and was the first film to have three hits in the Top Ten of the charts. Convinced that a club for teenagers is really a den of Beatnik iniquity, a property tycoon makes preparations to tear it down. Cliff and his friends stage a teen musical to try and save the club and prove that good clean fun and dancing is all they want. Co-starring Robert Morley, Carole Gray and the talented band The Shadows.

results.title: The Yellow leaf
results.creator_credit: Fergus McDonell, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A sympathetic study of an elderly widow, forced to leave her daughter’s household to live in a home for the aged. Shocked and disappointed at first, she overcomes her dejection when she fined that her new home offers congenial friends, new interests and a measure of independence she had not had before.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fergus McDonell, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Tomorrow is maybe
results.creator_credit: Michael Halvajian and KRMA-TV (Television station : Denver, Colo.)
results.brief_description: Examines man’s dilemma of how to behave toward his environment. Is modern urban life, with its artificiality and ugly trappings of pollution and untrammelled usage of nature’s commodities, an instinctive protection against the alien silence and solitude of the wilderness? Narrated by Ben Aviary.

results.title: Tomorrow in their hands
results.brief_description: Illustrates some of the uses of non-military aid to developing nations. Film of actual aid projects in El Salvador, Bolivia, India, Pakistan, Thailand and Ethiopia is used to show that the major objectives of US aid to these nations depends largely on self-help and cooperation in each participating country. Narrated by Jason Robards.

results.title: Tomorrow's salmon
results.creator_credit: Michael Maltby, Nielsen-Ferns International and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film describes the joint program of the Canadian and British Columbian governments to protect and strengthen stocks of Pacific salmon on which depend, either directly or indirectly, the jobs of 75,000 people and a $250 million industry. Well-documented and visually satisfying, the film alerts its audience to the necessity of sound conservation practices.

results.title: Tommy Tricker and the Stamp Traveller
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Rock Demers and Les Productions La Fete
results.brief_description: In this rollicking tale two members of a school stamp club, the artful scammer and a timid Ralph James compete to find an album of precious stamp treasures hidden on the other side of the world. In trying to track down the hidden stamps, Ralph and his sister, Nancy, uncover a secret magical formula that allows anyone who believes in magic to become so tiny they can ride in the picture on a postage stamp. But Ralph and Nancy are not the only ones with the secret. Tommy Tricker has also discovered the secret. Tommy Tricker has also discovered this method of travel and arrives in Australia before Ralph… but who will find the stamps?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Rubbo, Rock Demers and Les Productions La Fete

results.title: Tommy by The Who
results.creator_credit: Ken Russell, Robert Stigwood and Robert Stigwood Organisation
results.brief_description: Tommy by The Who is based upon the Rock Opera by Pete Townshend with additional material by John Entwistle and Keith Moon. It is the story of a deaf, dumb and blind boy who is eventually cured and becomes a rock celebrity. Features Oliver Reed, Ann-Margret, Roger Daltrey and Elton John with guest appearances by Eric Clapton, John Entwistle, Keith Moon, Paul Nicholas, Jack Nicholson, Robert Powell, Pete Townshend and Tina Turner.

results.title: The Young lions
results.creator_credit: Edward Dmytryk, Al Lightman and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Young Lions depicts the individual men and women on both sides of World War II. On the American side, two men struggle to endure the hardships of Boot Camp and the struggle to reclaim France. On the German side, a dedicated officer goes from the victories of the early years to the despair of defeat. Inevitably, the two sides are drawn together for the showdown. Marlon Brando dominates the film as the young German idealist who embraces Nazism but later comes to doubt it. The film also stars Montgomery Clift, Dean Martin, Hope Lange, Barbara Rush and May Britt. Based on the novel by Irwin Shaw.

results.title: The Yearling
results.creator_credit: Clarence Brown, Sidney A. Franklin and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The Yearling is a story of the Baxter family and their struggle to maintain their small farm. Jody, a twelve year old boy, yearns for a pet with whom he can share the last carefree days of his childhood. He adopts an orphaned fawn but their joyous times are tempered when the fawn grows into a yearling and becomes a threat to the family’s meagre crops. Based on Marjorie Kinnen Rawlings’ acclaimed novel.
